required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study to Compare ABT-494 Monotherapy to Methotrexate Monotherapy in Subjects With Rheumatoid Arthritis (RA) Who Have Not Previously Taken Methotrexate
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 3, Randomized, Double-Blind Study Comparing ABT-494 Once Daily Monotherapy to Methotrexate (MTX) Monotherapy in MTX-Naïve Subjects With Moderately to Severely Active Rheumatoid Arthritis

brief_summary.textblock: This is a randomized, double-blind study comparing ABT-494 monotherapy to Methotrexate (MTX) monotherapy in MTX-naïve subjects with moderately to severely active rheumatoid arthritis

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of participants achieving American College Rheumatology (ACR) 50 response
primary_outcome.description: ACR criteria measure improvements in tender and swollen joint counts, patient assessments of pain, global disease activity and physical function, physician global assessment of disease activity and acute phase reactant.

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of subjects achieving Clinical remission (CR) based on Disease Activity 28 (DAS28) C-Reactive Protein (CRP)
primary_outcome.description: CR based on DAS28 (CRP) response rate is defined as DAS28 (CRP) less than 2.6

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Health Assessment Questionnaire Disability Index (HAQ-DI)
secondary_outcome.description: HAQ-DI is a participant questionnaire with questions regarding the participant's illness and how it affect their daily life activities.

ACR criteria measure improvements in tender and swollen joint counts, patient assessments of pain, global disease activity and physical function, physician global assessment of disease activity and acute phase reactant.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Short Form-36 (SF-36) Physical Component Score (PCS)
secondary_outcome.description: SF-36 is a 36 item participant questionnaire with questions regarding participant health and daily activities.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of subjects achieving Low Disease Activity (LDA)
secondary_outcome.description: Low Disease Activity (LDA)is defined as Disease Activity Score (DAS)28 (CRP) <= 3.2

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in modified Total Sharp Score (mTSS)
secondary_outcome.description: For mTSS, x-rays of hand/wrist, feet joints and joint spaces are scored for erosions and joint space narrowing, which will be summed to determine the total score, which ranges from 0 (no damage) to 448.

ACR criteria measure improvements in tender and swollen joint counts, patient assessments of pain, global disease activity and physical function, physician global assessment of disease activity and acute phase reactant.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of subjects with no radiographic progression
secondary_outcome.description: It is defined as change in mTSS <= 0

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Disease Activity Score (DAS)28 C-Reactive Protein (CRP)
secondary_outcome.description: The DAS28 is a validated index of rheumatoid arthritis disease activity. Scores on the DAS28 range from 0 to 10.

arm_group.description: ABT-494 Dose B once daily monotherapy and Methotrexate matching placebo orally once weekly.
Methotrexate orally once weekly and ABT-494 matching placebo orally once daily.
ABT-494 Dose A once daily monotherapy and Methotrexate matching placebo orally once weekly.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Duration of symptoms consistent with RA for ≥ 6 weeks who also fulfill the 2010 ACR/EULAR classification criteria for RA.
- Naïve to Methotrexate (MTX) or, if already on MTX, have received no more than 3 weekly MTX doses with requirement to complete a 4-week MTX washout before the first dose of study drug.
- Subjects with prior exposure to conventional synthetic disease-modifying anti-rheumatic drugs(csDMARDs) other than MTX may be enrolled if completed the washout period.
- Subject meets the following minimum disease activity criteria: greater than or equal to 6 swollen joints (based on 66 joint counts) and greater than or equal to 6 tender joints (based on 68 joint counts) at Screening and Baseline Visits.
- Greater than or equal to 1 bone erosion on x-ray (by local reading) OR in the absence of documented bone erosion, both positive rheumatoid factor and positive anti-cyclic citrullinated peptide autoantibodies are required at Screening.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Intolerant to Methotrexate (MTX).
- Prior exposure to any Janus kinase (JAK) inhibitor (including but not limited to tofacitinib, baricitinib, and filgotinib).
- Prior exposure to any biologic disease-modifying anti-rheumatic drugs (bDMARDs).
- History of any arthritis with onset prior to age 17 years or current diagnosis, inflammatory joint disease other than RA (including but not limited to gout, systemic lupus erythematosus, psoriatic arthritis, axial spondyloarthritis including ankylosing spondylitis and non-radiographic axial SpA, reactive arthritis, overlap connective tissue diseases, scleroderma, polymyositis, dermatomyositis, fibromyalgia [currently with active symptoms]. Current diagnosis of secondary Sjogren's Syndrome is permitted.
